intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. globosus, commonly known as the globe buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It features showy, yellow flowers with five broad, rounded petals that resemble a globe, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and damp grasslands. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
